text:
I brought in my Dell laptop as I could not get it out of an "infinite boot loop" or "infinite restart." I ended up getting a new laptop and a data transfer. I interacted with all three team members listed on the site and they were all friendly and professional. The building is clean and organized.

However, I dropped it off at noon on a Thursday for it to be tested as they believed it was something else. The receipt/contract sheet I was given said 1-2 business days, but it ended up being 7 before they got to my computer, not counting Sunday. By this point I had already purchased a new laptop and decided I just wanted a data transfer. This was my first time using this business so I have no idea if this is indicative of the average wait period. I know they experienced property damage recently due to the snow storm and I would imagine that would set their workflow back a good bit. I like to give people the benefit of doubt.

They also sell a wide variety of new and used electronic products and when I went in the first time they even had a lot of unrelated merchandise jewelry, stickers, etc.

4/5 overall good experience. I normally don't leave reviews but I was impressed enough by this.

text: Tervor was very condescending with his remarks about my role as a customer. I did not feel that he valued my business. He offered other places that I take my business instead of assuring that my product would be repaired in the timely manner. I am sure that Tervor will not miss my one repair job, and his business will continue on.  However, ever customer is important to some businesses and I will spend my money at them.

resp.text:
My grandfather had a saying, "when you tell half truths, you deal in all lies."

I did call you, left a voicemail, saying that I didnt appreciate the way you spoke with my staff, and that your system had been here only 8 Business Days, when the repair time clearly posted at time of drop off was 10 business days. I told you that based on that you would have your system with Saturday or Monday, but in your review you state I didn't assure you when it would be repaired "in a timely manner", however I did tell you when, and it was timely based on the posted repair wait at time of drop off.

You state I offered other places, that is possibly the only true part of your review. I offered the other places around that could get to your repair if the wait wasn't doable for you.

You stated you was a "manager of a big box store" and that you "worked for AT&T" and that you don't treat a customer like this. To which I informed you I was "not a big box store, and I wouldn't let anyone treat my employee's wrongly."

Upon further looking into this, another lie came out. You are not a manager at AT&T, just a sales person. I know this, cause our business has over 55 lines with AT&T.

I hope you take this opportunity to learn to treat people the way you want to be treated, cause if you treat my staff improperly, I will call you out.

name: Barry Reding
text: My son took his computer to these people last Saturday. The technician told him the problem was most likely to he power supply and showed him the power supply that was needed. My son saw the price tag on the power supply read $80. Today (Wednesday) at 3pm my son went to pick up the computer because they hadn’t fixed it. They require a $35 deposit and would not give him the money back because it is non refundable. They did no work to the computer. I found this shady to say the least given the fact they did no work. I called and after being passed off to four different people I questioned the deposit. I was told by all four people that the deposit was necessary because people bring their computers there and never come to pick them up. I pointed out that was not the case here. I then asked if I could come there and purchase the power supply for $80 minus the $35 that had already been paid. At first the answer was yes you can do that but we won’t guarantee the part. I said I was fine with that. As the conversation progressed and I pressed for a solid answer on the purchase person number four (apparently the top of the ladder there) he began to to fish tail. He said power supplies can range in price. I reminded him the technician actually showed the power supply to my son that was needed for his computer. The price tag said $80. He said you can bring the computer back and we will look at it before the EOB today. At this point I wouldn’t trust these people to hold a penny. Person number four hung up me. It’s a scam. Stay away from these people.

resp.text:
Your system was dropped off on Saturday.  There is a sign clearly posted that it is currently 3 business days before a technician gets to your repair.  You choose to come pick up your system before the technician got to it on the 3rd business day (it was the next item on his list to work on for the record).  You spoke with 3 separate people when you asked for a refund on the non-refundable deposit every customer pays at drop off.  All 3 offered to have you bring the system back with no additional deposit for the technician to work on the system.  The technician even offered to work on the system immediately if you brought it back in today.  You refused.  One of the owners agreed to your request that the deposit be applied to purchase of a power supply, even though there is no verification that a power supply will fix the system.  This did not satisfy you either.  Services have been offered multiple times.  The bench fee is clearly covered at drop off and with signs on the counter at drop off.  If you had chosen to bring the system back, the $35 bench fee would be applied to your over all bill.  No one from our store told you to come pick up your system, what was wrong with it, or that we could not fix it.  We still offered you services that you choose to refuse.

The offers were made by multiple employees as well as one of the owners. All calls are recorded and the offers were recorded as well. The security video and audio is available upon request. And the offer still stands, you are welcome to bring it back in or apply the deposit to anything in store, same as owner offered on phone.

text: Stay Away, I took my repair in over 2 months ago. He told me parts are over seas. He is never open, does not answer the phone, ignores my calls. Thief!

resp.text:
We apologize that you feel we could do something to get parts here faster. Due to the COVID19 Pandemic, lock downs, and shutdowns in our Country as well as in many companies’ factories are in, such as China and Japan, parts have become hard to get. When they do arrive, they must clear customs. Normal shipping from overseas is 2-4 weeks, without any delays. We work as hard as possible to keep our customers happy, however some things are out of our control. Shipping is one.

As far as phone calls, our office is manned Mon-Fri 9AM-6PM, there is an auto attendant and Voice Mail should we be on other line. We also have email available on our drop off forms for customers to contact. If you have any questions please email me at info@nextgencomputers.net.

Please also give me the name your repair is registered in, as we do not have anything in the name "Allison England" and I will be glad to look into why it took so long.

resp.text: Hi Shelley! You know how much I appreciate you and your kind words. It pains me that small business owners spend their advertising and marketing dollars where they are ineffective. I hear horror stories like these from potential clients on a regular basis. I always advise them, whether they hire me or not, to "do this and do that" and "ask this and ask that" BEFORE selecting their next marketing agency. There are simply too many marketing service providers that over promise and under deliver, selling services that they know are not in the best interest of their clients. Even worse, many so-called "web marketing" agencies are experienced only with "traditional" marketing such as print, radio, or television, but expanded their services into the web arena in order to survive (or be more profitable). While most of these agencies are excellent at providing "traditional" marketing services, many of them are wholly unqualified to provide any type of online marketing services. They might be able to produce a "pretty" website, but that is a far cry from what is required to implement a successful, comprehensive web marketing campaign. Thanks again for leaving a review and allowing me to vent :-), Vernon Blake - Internet Marketing Specialist

I trust them implicitly and thank them for always being available when we need them.

In this day and age, it’s so nice to be able to do business with honest, decent, upstanding folks like these.

For the 7th year in a row, we have won the TripAdvisor award for best restaurant in Prattville.
- - - -
My restaurant is off the beaten path in downtown Prattville, AL making it a challenge to attract new customers. In the past, I paid to advertise in the local newspaper, print magazines, print and Internet yellow pages and an online paid listing, with limited success. I hired Bizeeo over 2 years ago (October 2012) to market my restaurant online.

They manage my website, social media, business listings and online reviews (reputation management). Since then, growth has exceed 25% for 2 consecutive years.  Due to our success with Bizeeo Marketing, I've discontinued all other forms of advertising.

Also, this year (2015), our restaurant won TripAdvisor's Certificate of Excellence award (out of 99 restaurants). This is the 3rd year in a row we have won this award. I highly recommend Bizeeo - you can see for yourself online what they've done for us.

resp.text: Hi Mickey, we have learned so much about online marketing (we are ALWAYS learning) while maintaining your website and other web properties. Of course, the foundation of it all is we are fortunate enough to work with a business owner that KNOWS what customer satisfaction is all about. name: Ben Harper
text: I had what I thought was a pretty nice web site, but I started getting sniped at by a very good and knowledgeable friend in NYC about it. I admit that I didn't pay much attention to keeping it updated and fresh, but I really didn't want to pay thousands of dollars for a new website just to get a few more clicks and occasional requests for repairs. So, I contacted Eric Hughes because I had seen some of his work and asked him if he would be interested in looking this over and give me an idea of what it might cost for a makeover. It needed a special something to make it look more interesting.  Eric reviewed what I had and gave me a cost that I could handle, and then he asked to give him a couple of weeks to work with it. When he got back to me (a little sooner that a couple of weeks), it looked very much better. He also created some spots that needed content, which I found and forwarded to him. He plugged them in and the website looked very much nicer than before and he did it within the budget figure, too, so we ran with it. I sent a note to my friend in NYC to critique it. She replied, "Better than before." Hah! That is as close to "A+" as she normally will go.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Ben! Glad that we could help get your website where you wanted it to be.

name: William Blackburn
text:
I rarely write reviews of companies, but this company did an outstanding job in repairing my computer.

I'd been having consistent trouble with my computer for quite some time and had tried to repair the issue I was having multiple times. While I am not a computer expert, the issue was centered around my wi-fi and appeared to be one of significant complexity.

I had previously asked a popular, nation-wide computer repair service to repair the issue and they failed to do so multiple times. I decided to call Networx Computer Technologies to see if they could get the issue sorted out and I am happy to report that they cleared up the issue very quickly and for a very reasonable price.

This organization has my full faith and the professionalism that they have shown me was simply outstanding and easily among the best I have experienced in this arena.

name: Elliott Knight
text: Best computer techs you could ask for. I have been here multiple times and they have always solved my issues very quickly. They don't overcharge and always treat you with respect.

name: Caleb Higdon
text: I had a problem with my PC that I couldn't figure out. I built my PC and I know what I'm doing, I only took it to them because i hoped the actual professionals could find the problem. I dropped it off and told them a little about the problem and they told me they shoot for 24-48hr repairs and there was a $30 minimum diagnostics fee. I agreed and left. They did the same troubleshooting things that I did and came to the same conclusion I did: a new motherboard would fix the problem. I accepted my fate. That was on Friday. On Monday I called and asked if there were anymore developments. They said the motherboard was the issue and that I could pick it up. I asked if the 30 dollars included tax. They said because it was an extended diagnostics period that the fee was now 45, to which I never agreed. I paid it anyway and when I got home I realized a fan was disconnected and so was my RGB LED strip. They didnt put them back the way I left it. On top of that, the pin header for the strip was bent and it snapped off when I tried putting it back in. I booted my system up using a different CPU and it worked fine, only I kept getting some error that wasn't there before. The broken pin and the error wasn't their fault, but they should've plugged the fan and strip back in and properly informed me  about the price hike from 30 to 45 dollars before I agreed to their terms. 3 stars because of the problems mentioned but I wont drop it down worse because I dont know how they could have fixed my computer. They certainly didn't make it better, though. The customer service was good.

name: Kevin Crowley
text:
Glad that Networx was willing to attempt to repair my motherboard. All other computer repair places I called in the area refused to attempt it.

Wish them all the best and will consider them first if I ever need computer services.
